[quote author=kingman002 link=topic=555655.msg4070071#msg4070071 date=1344268430]
Never got into Yugioh. I was into Pokemon since I was like 5 and stopped when I was 11 or 12.
[/quote]I was the total opposite. I was all into pokemon until after crystal then got into yugioh when it came out.

[quote author=Jmood link=topic=555655.msg4070068#msg4070068 date=1344268085]
Flip Flop Fog, If you can make it so the person cannot attack then you can send up to six monsters a turn.
[/quote]nice one, I would have to say ground collapse. You could have three of them on the field and other player would not be able to summon a monster
[/quote]heck no! inaba white rabbit! jumps over any cards on the field and attacks directly to opponents hit points! great way to get a good defensive card out of defense mode :3[/quote]

Axe of Fools, gf noob.

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote="(N)eon, post:25, topic:452788"]I used to have over 2,000 Yugioh cards… I collected EVERYTHING from Pikachu to Blue Eyes White Dragon =p[/quote]LOL I see what you did there <3

[hr]

So I was going through some old stuff from highschool(talking about the game brought back memories of my old friends ) and I found a stack of magic/trap cards that I had bought from a bloke when I had first started. I had like 50 dark hole’s :o

So let’s the change the topic a little now, if there was one card that you could put a number limit on what would it be and why. (choose a card that normally isn’t already limited )

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

It’s sort of sad how there isn’t a market for it anymore. There was a “yugioh table” when I was in high school. Bunch of the nerds would sit there just playing yugioh at lunch and breakfast.

I’m not really sure what happened to the game. Might have been the new cards coming out, many ruined the design of the game and just got cheesy. Kind of like Pokemon. Especially since Magic The Gathering was never really popular around here. Tournaments generally were funded by Yugioh players and they were extremely fun to attend.

You might be able to get a few dollars on super-ultra rare classic cards, but the price has been going down.

You can play Yugioh online on sites such as Dueling Network (unfortunately there is really no anti-cheat system, so you can draw like 5 cards and cheat. A friend of mine has been playing there lately and says there actually isn’t a large amount of cheaters).

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Davidi2:

I wouldn’t be surprised if some of my cards were worth a bit, they are quite old :o

Literally, there is close to no market for them. Within the last year I tried to sell all of my cards, including tons of Ultra Rares, for like $50 for over 800-1000 cards. Maybe it was just an unlucky sale.

[quote=“marcbob, post:18, topic:452788”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=555655.msg4068675#msg4068675 date=1344144056]

I used to play it a long time ago and I still have all my cards. I shoulda cashed out while I could have

Same…there is practically no market for them now.
[/quote]

I remember going to a comic book store and just buying packs of the cards. I even did a competition or two. Spent a lot of money back then on cards. (Well, when you’re young a little money seems like a lot)[/quote]

Yeah, a lot of money was invested in those things. I remember asking my sister to buy me a Buster Blader off of eBay :p. The local tournament around here closed down Yugioh and started up Magic The Gathering, although I do think they still have some Yugioh games from time to time.

Read full topic
